title: Force on a moving charge in a magnetic field

content.question: An electron moves in the plane of the page at a constant speed of <math alttext="v equals, 6 times 10 to the 6 power meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mo>°</mo></math> above the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math> axis, as shown. In the region through which the electron moves, a uniform magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B equals, 2 times 10 to the negative 5 power, tesla" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> is directed into the page. Which of the following is equal to the magnitude of the force exerted on the electron by the magnetic field?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.1 times 10 to the negative 28 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>28</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

<math alttext="9.6 times 10 to the negative 18 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

<math alttext="1.7 times 10 to the negative 17 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>17</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

<math alttext="1.9 times 10 to the negative 17 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>17</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.9 times 10 to the negative 17 power, newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>17</mn></mpadded></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
